abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column points out Google's hiring of respected Morgan Stanley executive Ruth Porat as chief financial officer is viewed as sign of maturity at company; notes that day after hiring Porat, Google shares added about $60 billion in market capitalization.
lead_paragraph: With the arrival of Ruth Porat as Google’s chief financial officer, the corporate culture shifts to mature and fiscally responsible from impulsive and undisciplined.

headline.main: Ruth Porat May Be Just What Investors Think Google Needs
headline.print_headline: A Google C.F.O. Who Can Call Time-Outs

snippet: With the arrival of Ruth Porat as Google’s chief financial officer, the corporate culture shifts to mature and fiscally responsible from impulsive and undisciplined.
